titles: A letter of the Earle of Corke to the state at Dvblin and sent over from thence by the governour to his lady in London : vvherein is shewed the barbarous cruelty the rebels have lately used to twenty of the Lord Barrimoores men at Coole, killing and spoiling all the rest of the English there : and how my Lord Barrimoore burned and spoiled their countrey and killed all the rebels hee could light upon : also the taking of Rochfords castle, killing the captaine and foure hundred of the Rebels : another defeat wherein two hundred and forty of the rebels were killed with little losse to the English : likewise the taking of Barnehely castle wherein were found a thousand barrels of wheat with other provision and victuals.
author: Cork, Richard Boyle, Earl of, 1566-1643.
notes: Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
keywords: Barrymore, David Fitz-David Barry, --  Earl of, 1605-1642.
